cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, expected to cross the Florida Big Bend this evening, sweep across north-central Florida and southeastern Georgia overnight, then move just offshore of the southeast U.S. coast on Tuesday before racing into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachicola/Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None (watch upgraded to warning for this stretch of coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC (includes Jacksonville area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Florida Peninsula, southeastern Georgia, and the Atlantic coasts of Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Sustained 35–45 kt (40–50 mph) with higher gusts possible Monday night into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft possible along the northeast Florida coast with minor coastal flooding at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with locally up to 8 inches, producing areas of flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday night into Tuesday across north Florida and southeast Georgia
